result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Atzel Amett Morales-Rivera

records.addlTxt: Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Atzel Amett Morales-Rivera appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III appeared by video for Atzel Amett Morales-Rivera.  Attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's witness is present. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02. Scheduling conference scheduled for December 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Atzel Amett Morales-Rivera appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert J Hampton III in court for Atzel Amett Morales-Rivera.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Hampton has been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Received and Filed: Attorney Robert Hampton

Defendant Atzel Amett Morales-Rivera not in court, in custody in Dodge Correctional.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. SPD failed to appoint counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Atzel Amett Morales-Rivera not in court, defendant in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Atzel Amett Morales-Rivera in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Atzel Amett Morales-Rivera in custody.  Sarah Mackenzie Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atzel Amett Morales-Rivera appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
